verses.kjv: And I looked, and, lo, a Lamb stood on the mount Sion, and with him an hundred forty and four thousand, having his Father’s name written in their foreheads.
verses.web: I saw, and behold, the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him a number, one hundred forty-four thousand, having his name, and the name of his Father, written on their foreheads.
verses.ct: Then I looked, and there was the Lamb, standing on Mount Zion. With him were 144,000 people who had his Father's name written on their foreheads.

verses.kjv: And I heard a voice from heaven, as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of a great thunder: and I heard the voice of harpers harping with their harps:
verses.web: I heard a sound from heaven, like the sound of many waters, and like the sound of a great thunder. The sound which I heard was like that of harpists playing on their harps.
verses.ct: I heard a sound from heaven like the roar of rushing waters and the rumble of powerful thunder. It also sounded like harpists playing their harps.

verses.kjv: And they sung as it were a new song before the throne, and before the four beasts, and the elders: and no man could learn that song but the hundred and forty and four thousand, which were redeemed from the earth.
verses.web: They sing a new song before the throne, and before the four living creatures and the elders. No one could learn the song except the one hundred forty-four thousand, those who had been redeemed out of the earth.
verses.ct: They sang a new song before the throne, in front of the 4 living creatures and the elders. No one could learn that song except the 144,000 who had been redeemed from the earth.

verses.kjv: These are they which were not defiled with women; for they are virgins. These are they which follow the Lamb whithersoever he goeth. These were redeemed from among men, being the firstfruits unto God and to the Lamb.
verses.web: These are those who were not defiled with women, for they are virgins. These are those who follow the Lamb wherever he goes. These were redeemed by Jesus from among men, the first fruits to God and to the Lamb.
verses.ct: These are the ones who kept themselves pure, never defiling themselves with women — they are virgins. They follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were redeemed from among humanity as the firstfruits offered to God and to the Lamb.

verses.kjv: And in their mouth was found no guile: for they are without fault before the throne of God.
verses.web: In their mouth was found no lie, for they are blameless.
verses.ct: No lie was ever found on their lips. They are blameless before the throne of God.

verses.kjv: And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people,
verses.web: I saw an angel flying in mid heaven, having an eternal Good News to proclaim to those who dwell on the earth, and to every nation, tribe, language, and people.
verses.ct: Then I saw an angel flying high overhead, carrying the eternal gospel to proclaim to everyone living on earth — to every nation, tribe, language, and people.

verses.kjv: Saying with a loud voice, Fear God, and give glory to him; for the hour of his judgment is come: and worship him that made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.
verses.web: He said with a loud voice, “Fear the Lord, and give him glory; for the hour of his judgment has come. Worship him who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and the springs of waters!”
verses.ct: He called out in a loud voice, "Fear God and give him glory, because the hour of his judgment has arrived! Worship the one who made the heavens, the earth, the sea, and the springs of water!"

verses.kjv: And there followed another angel, saying, Babylon is fallen, is fallen, that great city, because she made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.
verses.web: Another, a second angel, followed, saying, “Babylon the great has fallen, which has made all the nations to drink of the wine of the wrath of her sexual immorality.”
verses.ct: A second angel followed, declaring, "Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the great! She made every nation drink the wine of her furious immorality."

verses.kjv: And the third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, If any man worship the beast and his image, and receive his mark in his forehead, or in his hand,
verses.web: Another angel, a third, followed them, saying with a great voice, “If anyone worships the beast and his image, and receives a mark on his forehead, or on his hand,
verses.ct: A third angel followed them, crying out in a loud voice, "If anyone worships the beast and its image, and receives its mark on their forehead or on their hand,

verses.kjv: The same shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out without mixture into the cup of his indignation; and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:
verses.web: he also will drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is prepared unmixed in the cup of his anger. He will be tormented with fire and sulfur in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb.
verses.ct: that person will drink the wine of God's wrath, poured out full strength into the cup of his fury. They will be tormented with fire and sulfur in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the Lamb.

verses.kjv: And the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever: and they have no rest day nor night, who worship the beast and his image, and whosoever receiveth the mark of his name.
verses.web: The smoke of their torment goes up forever and ever. They have no rest day and night, those who worship the beast and his image, and whoever receives the mark of his name.
verses.ct: The smoke of their torment rises forever and ever. There is no rest, day or night, for those who worship the beast and its image, or for anyone who receives the mark of its name."

verses.kjv: Here is the patience of the saints: here are they that keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.
verses.web: Here is the perseverance of the saints, those who keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.”
verses.ct: This is what calls for endurance from God's people — those who keep God's commandments and hold firm to their faith in Jesus.

verses.kjv: And I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Write, Blessed are the dead which die in the Lord from henceforth: Yea, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labours; and their works do follow them.
verses.web: I heard a voice from heaven saying, “Write, ‘Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.’ ” “Yes,” says the Spirit, “that they may rest from their labors; for their works follow with them.”
verses.ct: Then I heard a voice from heaven say, "Write this: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on." "Yes," says the Holy Spirit, "they will rest from their hard work, and everything they did will go with them."

verses.kjv: And I looked, and behold a white cloud, and upon the cloud one sat like unto the Son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.
verses.web: I looked, and saw a white cloud, and on the cloud one sitting like a son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.
verses.ct: I looked up, and there was a white cloud. Sitting on the cloud was someone who looked like the Son of Man, wearing a golden crown on his head and holding a sharp sickle in his hand.

verses.kjv: And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him that sat on the cloud, Thrust in thy sickle, and reap: for the time is come for thee to reap; for the harvest of the earth is ripe.
verses.web: Another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him who sat on the cloud, “Send your sickle, and reap; for the hour to reap has come; for the harvest of the earth is ripe!”
verses.ct: Another angel came out of the temple, shouting to the one sitting on the cloud, "Swing your sickle and harvest! The time to reap has come — the earth's harvest is fully ripe!"

verses.kjv: And he that sat on the cloud thrust in his sickle on the earth; and the earth was reaped.
verses.web: He who sat on the cloud thrust his sickle on the earth, and the earth was reaped.
verses.ct: So the one sitting on the cloud swung his sickle over the earth, and the earth was harvested.

verses.kjv: And another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, he also having a sharp sickle.
verses.web: Another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven. He also had a sharp sickle.
verses.ct: Then another angel came out of the temple in heaven, and he too carried a sharp sickle.

verses.kjv: And another angel came out from the altar, which had power over fire; and cried with a loud cry to him that had the sharp sickle, saying, Thrust in thy sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth; for her grapes are fully ripe.
verses.web: Another angel came out from the altar, he who has power over fire, and he called with a great voice to him who had the sharp sickle, saying, “Send your sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth, for the earth’s grapes are fully ripe!”
verses.ct: Still another angel — the one who has authority over fire — came from the altar. He shouted to the angel with the sharp sickle, "Swing your sharp sickle and cut the clusters of grapes from the earth's vine, because the grapes are fully ripe!"

verses.kjv: And the angel thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and cast it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.
verses.web: The angel thrust his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vintage of the earth, and threw it into the great wine press of the wrath of God.
verses.ct: The angel swung his sickle across the earth, gathered the grapes, and hurled them into the great winepress of God's wrath.

verses.kjv: And the winepress was trodden without the city, and blood came out of the winepress, even unto the horse bridles, by the space of a thousand and six hundred furlongs.
verses.web: The wine press was trodden outside of the city, and blood came out of the wine press, even to the bridles of the horses, as far as one thousand six hundred stadia.
verses.ct: The winepress was trampled outside the city, and blood flowed out of it, rising as high as the bridles of horses and spreading for 1,600 stadia.
